notes: Two cluster-randomized controlled trials evaluating community-based monitoring interventions on health outcomes in Uganda. Experiment 1: Information & Participation (I&P, sample1==1, 2004-2009). Experiment 2: Participation only (P, sample1==0, 2006-2009). Randomization at health facility (hfcode) level within district (dcode) strata. Main outcomes: child mortality, weight-for-age z-scores, immunization, utilization. Table 3 (child mortality) is the flagship result.

design_audit.notes: Cluster-RCT at health facility level within district strata. Outcomes collapsed to health facility level (cluster-level means). Strata FE via areg, a(dcode). Robust SEs (not clustered since data is already at cluster level). Two experiments: I&P (sample1==1) and P-only (sample1==0).

claim_object.outcome_concept: Under-5 child mortality rate (crude deaths per year, annualized)
claim_object.estimand_concept: ITT effect of community monitoring on child death rate at health facility level
claim_object.target_population: Communities served by health facilities in treated districts, Uganda, 2006-2009

baseline_specs.label: Table3-PanelA-ColI-IP
baseline_specs.notes: areg death_year treatment if sample1==1, a(dcode) robust. Crude under-5 death rate, I&P experiment, strata FE.

baseline_specs.label: Table3-PanelA-ColII-IP-Infant
baseline_specs.notes: areg death_inf_year treatment if sample1==1, a(dcode) robust. Infant (under-12-month) death rate.

baseline_specs.label: Table3-PanelA-ColIV-IP-ExposureCorrected
baseline_specs.notes: areg death_exp treatment if sample1==1, a(dcode) robust. Exposure-corrected death rate (deaths per 1000 person-years).

constraints.notes: Baseline regressions have no controls beyond strata FE. Panel C adds baseline controls (avg_charge_gentreat, avgOP_baseline, hhs, and their squares) for cross-experiment comparison -- max 6 controls.

canonical.notes: Heteroskedasticity-robust SEs. Data is already at the cluster (health facility) level so no additional clustering needed. Matches paper's 'robust' option.

variants.notes: Cluster at health facility (redundant if data is at HF level, but a check).

budgets.notes: Budget covers: 5 baselines + 2 design variants + ~15 RC specs (controls, sample, form, weights). Controls pool is small (3 baseline controls + 3 squared terms).

sampling.notes: Only 3 baseline controls (+ 3 squares). Full enumeration of control subsets is feasible (2^3 - 1 = 7 main subsets + 2^6 - 1 = 63 with squares, but capped at budget).

diagnostics_plan.notes: Table 1-2 in paper test pre-treatment balance across treatment and control.
Check differential attrition in mortality data collection.

design_audit.notes: Same RCT as G1 but individual-level data (children). Clustered at health facility level. Outcome is weight-for-age z-score. Sample restricted by age and z-score range (-4.5 to 4.5) and growth chart cutoff (Cortinovis et al. 1997).

claim_object.estimand_concept: ITT effect on child nutritional status (weight-for-age z-score)
claim_object.target_population: Children under 5 in communities served by treated health facilities, Uganda

baseline_specs.label: Table5-ColI-IP-Infants
baseline_specs.notes: areg zw1 treatment if s821a<13 & zw1>-4.5 & zw1<4.5 & s821b<cort97 & sample1==1, a(dcode) cluster(hfcode). Infants 0-12 months, I&P experiment.

baseline_specs.label: Table5-ColII-IP-Children
baseline_specs.notes: areg zw1 treatment if s821a>12 & zw1>-4.5 & zw1<4.5 & sample1==1, a(dcode) cluster(hfcode). Children 13-59 months.

constraints.notes: Baseline regressions have no controls beyond strata FE. Panel C adds baseline facility controls.

canonical.notes: Clustered at health facility level (randomization unit). Matches paper's cluster(hfcode).

budgets.notes: Smaller budget since the weight outcome has fewer design variants. Main axes: experiment type, age group, outlier trimming, outcome transform.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Balance check for weight/height data subsample.
